adult brain. Presumably the child brain is something like a notebook as
one buys it from the stationer’s. Rather little mechanism and lots of blank
sheets. (Mechanism and writing are from our point of view almost synony-
mous.) Our hope is that there is so little mechanism in the child brain that
something like it can be easily programmed. The amount of work in the
